name: pedal
content:

B2 a small part of a machine or object that is pushed down with the foot to operate or move the machine or object: the brake/accelerator pedal This sewing machine is operated by a foot pedal. He stood up on the pedals of his bike to get extra power as he cycled up the hill. Compare
treadle
Tuned_In/iStock/Getty Images Plus/GettyImages
a part on a piano or organ that you press with your foot : He started playing the piano as soon as his legs were long enough to reach the pedals. A typical church organ has four rows of keyboards and foot pedals under the bench.
More examplesFewer examplesSlowly depress the brake pedal.My foot slipped off the pedal.Put your foot fully on the pedal.Press the pedal.You use your right foot for both pedals.
